hackathon-eligibility:
Any college student or college graduate who graduated less than a year ago. The event is open to all students to attend but only students who have registered, confirmed registration, and checked into the event are elligible for prizes.
The maximum amount of people in a prize elligible team is

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best IoT Hack Using a Qualcomm Device

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Best Use of AWS Description: $250 AWS Credit
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Use of Amazon Web Services

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=11929 W Airport Blvd, Stafford, TX 77477, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: A project must be a original idea, ideally formed at the hackathon. It must showcase the hackers unique perspective of the problem they are trying to solve or tool they are creating.
Each project must have a great pitch. Sell your project to us to earn points!
We would love to see a demo of your product including the code and frameworks used.

hackathon-location-address: 11929 W Airport Blvd, Stafford, TX 77477, USA
